intro: Hemsleya grandiflora, commonly known as the large-flowered hemslay, is a member of the Acanthaceae family and is native to the tropical regions of South America. It is a herbaceous perennial plant characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pink and violet. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments and has lance-shaped leaves with a slightly hairy surface. Its flowers bloom in summer and are often visited by hummingbirds and other pollinators. Hemsleya grandiflora is valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and adaptability to cultivated conditions.
